description: Application to extend the time limit for the implementation of planning permission reference P080153  dated 16 June 2008 for the 'Retention of Mount Pleasant and Warner Street facades of 29-39 Mount Pleasant and demolition of building / structure behind the retained facades.  Provision of new floors (including basement) and erection of a 2-storey principal roof extension and part 1 to 3-storey side sloped roof extension together with alterations to Mount Pleasant and Warner Street facades in connection with the change of use and refurbishment of the buildings to provide for B1 (office) and flexible B1/A3 (office/restaurant/café) floor space together with the change of use and refurbishment of no. 5 Rosebery Avenue to provide for A1 (retail) and 2 residential dwellings.'
decision_conditions: REASON:  The proposed development by virtue of its height, scale, mass, bulk and materials would have an adverse impact on the building itself, the surrounding streetscene, the character and appearance of the Rosebery Avenue Conservation Area, the locally listed buildings nearby and the setting of the neighbouring grade II listed buildings known as 45-57 Mount Pleasant. The proposal is contrary to PPS5, policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7.8 of the London Plan 2011, policy CS9 of the Core Strategy (2011) and the adopted SPG ‘Conservation Area Design Guidelines’.
